The server forgot to use safe primes and encrypted a secret using RSA with blum integers. Can you decrypt 1787578571390163223754867401702381040728298843333777170810377710339228211606631325089190647272052802725294804757343894160570209840679873252971680968760011 and reveal the message?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6407928960174516908260331065623649709065699779702364721551278475475894203790269981398714838973814710962280903313742646528418609680105972340820779214536437, e=1002254819939088815802223721120682608781481526499072531188100866695528448112990991118957964094215149083956052507406663068471401288329418085356646526216959
The lower 104 bits of p are: 22655381490670016986850652648347528787


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{lp1r10hx}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1787578571390163223754867401702381040728298843333777170810377710339228211606631325089190647272052802725294804757343894160570209840679873252971680968760011
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6407928960174516908260331065623649709065699779702364721551278475475894203790269981398714838973814710962280903313742646528418609680105972340820779214536437, e=1002254819939088815802223721120682608781481526499072531188100866695528448112990991118957964094215149083956052507406663068471401288329418085356646526216959
The lower 104 bits of p are: 22655381490670016986850652648347528787

extra_info: p=106226833212869231011785604309394142158515535201731047003452807995260255333971, q=60323072488978287202286480950569121690412249491592395243519239366429812253847, Ï†(n)=6407928960174516908260331065623649709065699779702364721551278475475894203790103431493012991455600638877020940049893718743725286237859000293459089146948620
